result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Uploaded and processed document to Sharefile, sent paper copy to dispatch, printed warrant card.

10:50 AM Defendant Mark Harold Tody not in court.  Attorney Daniel James Chapman in court for Mark Harold Tody.   Attorney Bruce Robert Poquette in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case and recites appearances. Attny Chapman makes statement. State requests warrant and bail forfeiture proceedings.   Court grants request.  Warrant authorized (Statewide) as requested and bail forfeiture to begin.
Bail/Bond Review scheduled for June 24, 2022 at 09:00 am.

records.addlTxt: Status conference on May 24, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Converted from CBS $500 

ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/ No Possession or Consumption of Alcoholic Beverages.  May not possess any controlled substance or paraphernalia.     No drug use without a valid prescription and if prescribed must take as DR ordered.  

Defendant shall be subject to testing of their blood, breath, saliva and/or urine to ensure compliance with absolute sobriety provision. Within 24 hours of release from custody (not including weekends/holidays) defendant shall report to Justice Point Pre-Trial Services at 10610 Main Street Suite 101, Hayward, WI 54843. Phone: 715-804-0109 OR 715-338-3976 for orientation and to establish testing procedures and options.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: 8:56AM Defendant Mark Harold Tody in court, appearing by video from in custody in Sawyer County Jail, with attorney Daniel James Chapman, appearing by video.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Court calls case and recites appearances.    DEF received copy of criminal complaint in court on this date.  DEF verifies name, DOB, and address.  Court enters NG to misd. on behalf of DEF.  Atty Chapman waives time limits for prelim.  Atty Chapman request to argue bond.  State has no objection.  Atty Chapman argues bond modification, requests SIBS.  State makes statement on bond, objecting to SIBS.  Court sets bond, converts CBS to SIBS, conditions to remain unchanged.  Court sets STC for 5/24/22 at 10AM.
